Controls.Description: All Users/Identities must be granted minimum required permissions using Role Based Access Control (RBAC)
Controls.Rationale: Granting minimum access by leveraging RBAC feature ensures that users are granted just enough permissions to perform their tasks. This minimizes exposure of the resources in case of user/service account compromise.
Controls.Recommendation: Clean up any unauthorized users on the Traffic Manager Profile. Run command Remove-AzureRmRoleAssignment -SignInName '{signInName}' -Scope '{scope}}' -RoleDefinitionName {role definition name}'. Run 'Get-Help Remove-AzureRmRoleAssignment -full' to get the complete details about this command.

Controls.Description: Traffic Manager profile should use HTTPS protocol for endpoint monitoring
Controls.Rationale: Use of HTTPS ensures server/service authentication and protects data in transit from network layer man-in-the-middle, eavesdropping, session-hijacking attacks.
Controls.Recommendation: To enable HTTPS protocol for endpoint monitoring, go to Azure Portal --> your Traffic Manager Profile --> Configuration -->  Select HTTPS --> Save.
